questions.question_text:
A company produces various products using Process manufacturing.
The manufacturer makes two co-products from a formula and rarely produces the primary formula item. The costs of making the co-products are inflated. The manufacturer must update the costs of producing the co-products and change the formula to not produce the primary formula item.
You need to change the primary formula item type.
What should you do?

choices.A: Associate the costs to produce by-products with the items
choices.B: Change the primary formula item to use the planning item type
choices.C: Change the cost of the primary formula item to zero and then recalculate the item cost
choices.D: Change the production type to Bill of materials and recalculate the item cost

discussion.content: B - Planning item is correct. This is a text book case for planning items

choices.C: Set the Automatic planning option for each unscheduled job to No
choices.E: Manually schedule each unscheduled job to the next period of the start of the next season
choices.A: Set the Automatic planning option for each unscheduled job to Yes
choices.D: Manually schedule each unscheduled job forward from the date of the end of the season
choices.B: Manually schedule each unscheduled job on its due date

discussion.content: A and B are the correct answers

comments.content: This still doesn't work because it needs to be 2 weeks prior to end of season or at least a 2 week break between seasons which is not mentioned. AB are the only options that achieve this.

discussion.content: Would make a lot more sense if option D was "backward" from the end of the season, not "forward".

comments.content: Go to the Kanban schedule board, select Board, then Plan unplanned kanbans. At the bottom part is the Automatic planning button (Yes/No). So you select all the unplanned kanbans, click to Yes in Automatin Planning and Ok. So, A and B are correct.

discussion.content: Automatic planning quantity is a number, not Yes|No value

D doesn't look correct.
A or E?

comments.content: AB for me. E doesn't work because the requirement is 2 weeks prior to end.

questions.question_text:
A customer produces light projection toys for holiday decorations throughout the year.
You are in the first month of a season. Production flows take one day to complete.
The floor supervisor reports that seasonal production targets will not be met. You review the Kanban schedule board and identify thousands of unplanned jobs.
You need to plan the jobs to be completed two weeks prior to the start of the next season.
What are two possible ways to achieve this goal? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.D: Set the batch order as a rework batch
choices.A: Reserve the reworked inventory after estimation
choices.B: Set the item as a Formula production type
choices.E: Pick the reworked inventory after estimation
choices.C: Specify the batch number of the batch order

discussion.content: ACD. A rework batch order must be created, and an existing batch number must be specified as the batch that is to be reworked. Set the option to reserve the reworked inventory.

A, B and D are correct.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamicsax-2012/appuser-itpro/create-a-rework-batch-order

questions.question_text:
A customer produces light projection toys for holiday decorations throughout the year. The production process creates the projections toy at the following work cells stands, main assembly, electric, visuals, and packaging.
Vendors must create visual templates for the company for each season. They must manage the transfer of visual templates to the warehouse. Each transfer for each vendor must use the same purchase agreement.
You need to configure the subcontracted transfer activity.
What should you do?

choices.D: Set the transfer activity Freighted by value to Carrier. Ensure that purchase agreements include the vendor ID of the warehouse.
choices.A: Set the transfer activity Freighted by value to Carrier. Ensure that purchase agreements include the vendor ID of the vendor.
choices.B: Set the transfer activity Freighted by value to Shipper. Ensure that purchase agreements include the vendor ID of the vendor.
choices.E: Set the transfer activity Freighted by value to Shipper. Ensure that purchase agreements include the vendor ID of the warehouse.
choices.F: Set the transfer activity Freighted by value to Recipient. Ensure that purchase agreements include the vendor ID of the vendor.
choices.C: Set the transfer activity Freighted by value to Recipient. Ensure that purchase agreements include the vendor ID of the warehouse.

discussion.content:
C is correct.
